section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The subscriber is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999.
explanation: The text uses both "Customer" and "subscriber" to refer to the same party (Centrack International). While likely intended to be synonymous, this interchangeable use without explicit definition can lead to confusion, particularly if disputes arise regarding which entity bears specific responsibilities under the contract. It is better to only use one term throughout the document.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term.
explanation: The text refers to renewal for "one (1) or more one (1) month periods". This is ambiguous. Does this mean only one month renewals are allowed, or can there be multiple one-month renewals, or renewals for periods longer than one month? The phrasing lacks clarity and could lead to disputes over the renewal terms. The initial term is for six months. The text does not explicitly say how long the renewal is for.

section: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, no termination of this Agreement for any reason whatsoever shall relieve the Customer of the obligation to pay all amounts due to i-on and to make such payments on a timely basis.
explanation: The term "all amounts due" is ambiguous. Does this mean all amounts due up to the termination date, or does it include fees for the remaining term of the agreement, even though services are no longer being provided? This lack of clarity could lead to disputes about the customer's financial obligations upon termination.
